decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly building a board presence of Human creatures with powerful passive abilities and tribal synergies. By playing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage to disrupt opponents' strategies, while boosting the power of your own creatures with cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish, it aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. A key aspect of the deck is also the use of Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play at instant speed, allowing for surprise plays and maintaining pressure on the opponent.

The key concept of this deck is to apply constant pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan through aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. The deck aims to quickly establish board presence with high-impact threats like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf, while also leveraging powerful disruption cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's hand and disrupt their key plans. Additionally, the deck includes a variety of removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to efficiently deal with the opponent's threats.

The deck focuses on using the combo between Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana, which can be used to activate abilities like Knight of the Reliquary or Walking Ballista. The creatures toolbox aspect allows for flexibility in finding the right creature for the situation using cards like Collected Company and Chord of Calling. The control elements provided by Spell Queller and Reflector Mage help to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Retreat to Coralhelm can provide additional value and card selection.

The main idea behind this deck is to quickly assemble the Krark-Clan Ironworks combo by sacrificing artifacts and generating mana to loop through your deck and eventually cast Emrakul, the Aeons Torn to win the game. The deck focuses on both card draw and mana generation through artifacts such as Mox Opal and Scrap Trawler, allowing for explosive turns and combo potential. With the right setup and sequencing, this deck can generate a large amount of mana and card advantage to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently.

The main concept of this Aggro-Death and Taxes Modern deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Leonin Arbiter and Ghost Quarter, while also applying pressure with efficient and disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Mirran Crusader. The deck aims to control the game by limiting the opponent's resources and tempo, while also presenting threats that can quickly close out the game. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Aether Vial to cheat in creatures and gain incremental advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to disrupt opponents and maintain board control. The deck also focuses on ramping up mana quickly using cards like Sakura-Tribe Elder, Search for Tomorrow, and Farseek to enable the casting of powerful spells like Scapeshift and Bring to Light. These spells allow the player to win the game by sacrificing lands and searching for multiple Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate massive amounts of mana quickly. The deck utilizes various artifacts and land fetching cards to ensure a consistent and powerful mana base. The main goal is to control the game through powerful spells and creatures such as Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Emrakul, the Promised End. The deck aims to overwhelm and outvalue the opponent with big threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Wurmcoil Engine, while also having answers like Oblivion Stone and Ghost Quarter to deal with threats.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By using cards like Bloodbraid Elf and Noble Hierarch to ramp into powerful threats like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain that pressure throughout the game. With a mix of removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Dismember, as well as mana ramp and fixing from cards like Ancient Stirrings and Cavern of Souls, the deck is capable of adapting to different matchups and navigating through potential threats.

The deck is focused on quickly building a wide board presence with cheap artifact creatures and using Cranial Plating to equip them for massive damage. Key cards like Mox Opal, Springleaf Drum, and Arcbound Ravager enable fast mana ramp and creature buffs. Steel Overseer further boosts the power of the team, while Etched Champion and Master of Etherium provide protection and additional strength. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of aggressive attacks, utilizing the affinity mechanic to reduce the cost of its numerous artifacts.

The main concept of this Aggro - Affinity deck is to swarm the board with artifacts creatures, pump them with Steel Overseer and Cranial Plating, and close out the game quickly with damage from cards like Galvanic Blast and Vault Skirge. The deck focuses on efficient and aggressive plays, utilizing cards like Signal Pest and Ornithopter to apply pressure early on. With a mix of powerful artifacts and synergistic abilities, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a fast victory.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced Human tribal strategy. By utilizing cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant to pump up the team, along with disruptive cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter, the deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot while maintaining pressure with powerful creatures like Mantis Rider. The mana base is optimized to ensure smooth mana production for casting creatures quickly, making it a formidable force in the Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on fast, aggressive play using Human creatures with abilities that disrupt your opponent's game plan. By using cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter to control your opponent's spells, and with the support of Aether Vial and Unclaimed Territory to quickly play out your creatures, you aim to overwhelm your opponent before they can establish their own strategy. The synergy between cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant allows you to grow your board presence rapidly, while cards like Reflector Mage provide additional disruption to gain you the advantage in a quick, efficient manner.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly generate a large storm count by casting multiple spells in a single turn, utilizing cards like Pyretic Ritual, Gifts Ungiven, and Baral, Chief of Compliance to generate mana and card advantage. The deck relies on key combo pieces like Pyretic Ritual, Desperate Ritual, and Grapeshot to finish off the opponent in one explosive turn. It also includes card draw and selection spells like Serum Visions and Sleight of Hand to help find combo pieces quickly. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces and execute a lethal Grapeshot for the win.

The main concept of this UR Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while controlling the game with counterspells and removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Cryptic Command. The deck also aims to generate card advantage and maximize its resources with cards like Serum Visions and Snapcaster Mage. Additionally, the deck utilizes powerful finishers like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to win the game. The inclusion of cards like Blood Moon and Through the Breach further adds versatility and disruption to the deck's game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements such as counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also utilizing card advantage through Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The key win condition is to cheat out Emrakul, the Aeons Torn using Through the Breach, providing a powerful threat that can close out the game quickly. Blood Moon is included to disrupt opponent's mana base, while cards like Lightning Bolt and Abrade provide additional removal options. Overall, the deck aims to control the game until it can resolve its powerful win condition.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, board wipes, and removal spells while also maintaining card advantage and protecting its own life total through card draw and lifegain. It establishes early game board presence with defensive creatures like Wall of Omens and disrupts opponents' mana bases with cards like Spreading Seas and Field of Ruin. The win condition is through efficient removal and countering threats until the late game, where it can take control with planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Gideon Jura.
